values: i remember this place. it's change a little, huh? looks like lots of my old friends lost their LJ enthusiasm much like i did. but the ones that are still here seem to be pretty much the same. but that's good--that's who they are. there's brooke... "I enjoy solitude, and long walks on the beach as long as people are being eaten by sharks nearby." it sucks to forget that you miss someone but still neat when you remember. i hope her and her health are doing good. erin, who sent me some new-fangled nudge, still seems to be interested in my life. kind of sweet and unusual, but i've always known her to have a ton of friends. then there's white mario and i think i saw nina somewhere back there. she's in prague? never saw that coming but, at the same time, not too surprised. wish i had enough time or interest to hang out with some of you or at least do entries. well, i'll do one later if it comes to mind.
http://www.craigslist.org/eby/car/96487577.html any of you that knew me in highschool would understand what that means to me. i haven't seen one on the road in years. i miss mine. <3 <3

http://www.collegehumor.com/movies/950646

i saw that and decided i had to make a post for it. but in order to make it seem like that wasn't the primary reason for this, here's some more stuff.

monique's birthday party is on saturday. i hope everything goes okay. then there's bug-o-rama on sunday and sac raceway, but i'm afraid i'll wake up too late and be too hungover to make it. we'll see.

school is good but really slow and boring. time to go to work now.

it sucks that my return to livejournal is sparked by the way-premature death of nina's big, gorgeous, shiny black cat, Jonas. i spent a fair amount of time with him during his kittenhood but only saw him a couple times as an adult which makes his death seem that much more untimely. to me, he had a commanding aura. he seemed somehow powerful. my sincere condolence to her. i rarely talk to nina anymore so i appreciate that she considered to inform me of the news. i thought i would check her lj for more information and found out she got a new account. then i poked around my friends page and user info and was happy to see i've retained almost all my friends... at least all the ones that mattered. i may have to update some stuff after this. i also noticed that brooke is still being overwhelmed with school and dealing with strange jerks on an everyday basis but still prevailing with immense spirit. all while being the same old journal whore i've known her to be. you, mario, and i should go to a nice, small hardcore show again. at second look, a few of my friends' journals seem to be pretty dead. what losers. i took my first college class last semester and passed with a 99.13%. the teacher loved me (in a guy way... straight, that is). so i may just be on to something with this school stuff and might even up the ante to two classes this fall. monique and i are doing great. it's more apparent everyday that i'm going to have to fork over the money for a ring someday. i don't mind that. i mind any public dancing and conversing i'll have to do with awkward and rarely-seen relatives. that sort of anxiety kills me. oh, i'm 25 now everyone. don't worry, i don't care.

well i flipped every switch that i could find on my way out just to upset you more, just to keep you busy, just to make you angry, just because you were right, just because you were...
until yesterday i forgot how amazing photos are in National Geographic.
bill cosby is the shit. well, now more than ever. oleander tomorrow! er, today!

went with my my old lady (pictured, being the cute dork she is) and alisha. this was my first time at capitol garage.
cindy and nina ended up meeting us there. nina's boy toy showed up later, too.
talk about a small place. but it wasn't very cramped since maybe 30 people showed. pretty depressing when i think about how big their shows must've been in the mid/late 90's when their big radio hit was all out and stuff. they've been releasing albums all this while and i own all 4. oh, and the two opening bands cancelled! i can't remember their names now, but it's got to be better that way. their cancellations were last-minute, so screw them for not thinking 30 people was a big enough crowd to play for.
they played great. well, i was nearly drunk, so it sounded fantastic to me. they did a really long set, probably due to having no openers of any kind. scott lucas (lead) did some solo songs to start out with and the drummer beat his heart out once he came on.
dude brought his kid. cool dad. i woulda hated being at something like that when i was his age.
the girls took breaks outside for some reason. they don't smoke. they're just not true local h fans.
alisha lives on the edge! this is just to fill the usual after-concert speedo shot quota. move on.
some artsy pics:

Who is your best friend?

from here... When: Saturday July 17, 2004 Time: 11:00am Bands: Lit / Key To Arson / Five Minute Ride Where: Sutters Landing; B & 28th (over the RR tracks) Cost: FREE

okay, so i haven't posted in like, a week or three or something. i haven't even checked my friends page in almost that long. just no time or interest to make time. i still haven't done my obligatory local h entry with pics. some day i'll get back into the lj thing and read through everything i missed.

until then... toodle-ooh.

edit: oh, i still love my girlfriend! she's the best.

goddamn. i can't sleep for shit. well, i haven't tried in about two hours, so i'm going to again after this. i somewhat blame the decent amount of sleep i got last night. but i mostly blame the sparks i chugged around 8. crazy stuff. the numerous standard beers i had afterward can't even counter it. but the show was pretty awesome, if not depressingly vacant. there was maybe 25 people in the whole place. but, i don't want to get into all the details or else i'll see the sun come up. plenty of pics later. goodnight.

okay, i was reading nina's entry about her wonderful, recently deceased basil and i thought about my past pets, and thought about maddy, and realized how fucking much i miss her. then i realized i had a dream last night involving me, mario, brooke, and maybe some other people supposedly at jesse's place in oregon. and someone brought like 4 kittens! jesse already had one tiny one. and i was busy making sure the bigger (~12week) kittens didn't hurt the little (~4week and miniature) kitten. it was bitchin. what's weird was nina's entry was about a dream, too. i didn't make that connection until now. the night before i dreamt of a weird amusement park that existed in the canopy of some dense jungle. there was this long tube that i was sliding through super fucking fast among the trees. there was a group of girls behind me that were all too prissy to go on it. i was all hyped up from the ride that when i got off at the end and saw them walking up on the walkway, i flipped em off and told them they sucked. oh, and this was all at night with no outside lights. sometime last week i had a realistic dream about 4 or 5 rather large spiders. at the end, my psyche decided to throw in a big, black and red, shiny scorpion.
DO YOU LIKE OR DISLIKE KETTLE CORN? everyone answer. i'm curious.

there are a good handful of 90's bands that i credit with greatly influencing my musical sense and taste and many of which i never got the chance to see live. well, one of them, Local H, is coming to the capitol garage on the 8th! thanks to alisha for informing me, albeit through her lj entry. so that show, along with oleander a week later, and fall out boy 8 days after that, i'm going to have three broken-up work weeks in a row. i don't mind that at all, but i wonder how my boss will take it. there's also counterfit and finch sometime in late july that i'm very much looking forward to.

wednesday at work my workmates half-ass surprised me and two other tauruses and took us to mountain mikes for dinner buffet. that was cool. otherwise, normal week. nice of the weekend to arrive. and even though it's three days, it's actually going to feel shorter than a normal weekend due to me helping brooke move to SJ. mario told me she wanted us up at 9am tomorrow for some godawful reason. i said no. we can't move into her new place until sunday so i don't see what the point of waking up so damn early to load a truck and have it sit in front of her current house all day. if i have to get up early just to fetch the truck by a certain time, that's okay. no reason to drag mario out of bed and i'll just go home and back to sleep after. we can load it in the afternoon/evening. sun's up til 8 anyway. hopefully she'll read this and call the house tonight. or, if i win, just wait til tomorow afternoon to make contact. i made a new icon from the latest get fuzzy strip. i want to try circulating my icons regularly like most everyone else does. it's an opportunity to express myself. yeah. my girlfriend's asleep behind me. i feel oddly guilty for being up and on the computer, but it's way too friggin early still. i feel like playing a game anyway. goodnight.

there's a few things at the drive-thru records store that i want. just go to the sale section and get the finch box and even the grey finch shirt ($5!). then some nfg things like a blue or black lion hoodie, some more $5 shirts, and the poster. okay? thanks. whire you're at it, go ahead and throw in the something corporate poster and starting line shirt.

Username:
From Go-Quiz.com haven't posted in a while. umm. jury duty was awesome. i went for 4 hours the first day where i ended up in a courtroom and they started going through jurors. went back for one hour the next day where they finished the process up and let everyone left go home. so i got both days off work, paid for, and spent time with monique. went back to work friday which, being a friday, was pretty relaxed. good week. this weekend i... went to jc penney for an overpriced haircut and some good, cheap shirts. washed my car and dried with a towel that must've been dirty. my mom and her fiance dropped by sunday and we ate lunch. she met monique, which i guess is a big deal to some people, but whatever. of course they liked each other. now i go to work. today is monique's first day back at childtime and she just called and it seems to be going good, albeit tiring. tomorrow's a half day for me for alisha's birthday dinner. that's all for now. rest in peace, basil.

i have jury duty today! i'm excited. why? because that means ill paid for 8 hours and be home by, what, 5pm? at which point i'll have the whole evening to myself to relax and probably eventually see my lady. funny

bday present? }:D i found ! i recommend. today is the last day i'll see maddy. i'm going to work and mario and serena will take her to meet her new owner at 3:30. i'm okay with it right now, but i probably won't be later.

on the bay bridge. i got a kick out of taking pictures out of my sunroof. you can see the golden gate in the distance on the left.
mario and brooke in line with me at poundsf.
fireball ministry
no motiv
andrew w.k.
the set list. i wish i remembered to take it after.
i think this is jimmy coup thrashing on the axe. no, i wasn't sucking his dick... but i could have if i was so inclined. i almost knocked his mic stand down on one of my trips on stage and spun around in my drunken stupor and put it back for him. he gave me a quick thumbs up.
this must be gregg r. i think it was announced that it was his birthday that day. he looks like a taurus.
and the man himself, andrew wilkes-krier. also a taurus.

i got pretty drunk. moreso than i anticipated. but i had a blast. i'll go to his show again any day.

the crowd went wild. the whole time. get on stage if you want. put your arm around andrew or any of the other guys and sing along if you want. then feel free to dive off and make your way to the pit. i did it all.
the aftermath
we dawdled around a bit after the show. i, the drunk one, found mario's trampled glasses and we waited around to catch our breaths and maybe see some of the guys come out to mingle. instead the bouncer guys started getting loud so we left. still drunk, i made myself puke by my car. three more followed involuntarily and in rapid succession. i laid in my car for a few minutes while took in the fresh air and got my motor skills ready for the drive. yes, i felt guilty. but i did fine. we dropped brooke off at her car in pleasanton so she could drive to mike's and then mario and i had some mini cheeseburgers and onion rings at the denny's there. it hit tha spizot. i felt alot better afterwards and we headed home. you haven't lived until you've set cruise control to one hundred and thirty miles per hour.
visuals and, of course, the usual panoramic shot.
happy birthday, ! maddy says happy birthday, too. i'm off to the vet now to have her cast removed, everyone. entry later tonight, hopefully.

holy shit. the BEST time. i was on stage at least three times. i got pretty drunk. i even kissed andy.

shower and sleeeeeep.

okay, i decided to throw it back together anyway.
The Exit.
they were decent.
really good drummer.
kinda looked like me.
i hate him.
during intermission they prejected the kings game onto the wall next to us. pretty bitchin since it was the end of the 4th quarter of a reasonably close game. what wasn't bitchin was how it cut off with some 30 seconds left and came back on a couple minutes later for the post game stuff. the timing seemed too suspicious to be accidental, but i can't think of why it would be intentional. we had to text message monique's mom to find out who won.
Muse. i made plans to go to this concert because it was cheap, local, and jacky invited me. i made an effort a week before to get to know them by downloading the album and playing it a few times in my car. i could tell it was good stuff though it never got a chance to grow on me. turned out jacky wouldn't be able to go so i took monique. so her and i are going to our first concert together and it's for a band that neither of us knows very well. so it was a unconventional concert experience for me, but awesome in it's own right.
<3
they sounded superb. downright flawless. they put out as much energy as their radiohead-ish sound would allow. they played Stockholm Syndrome (probably my favorite song on the new album) twice which sounded great. the way the hard-edged grunge would drop into a sublime, piano and vocal-driven chorus is something else. if there were one song that enveloped every facet of muse's sound, that would be it. had i known their songs a bit better, been there by myself, or drunk, i woulda pushed myself up front and into the fray.
The Empire. a new small-on-the-outside, big-on-the-inside venue on 15th and R. the atmoshphere, layout, accomodations, aesthetics, acoustics... they were all great as far as i could tell. 3 bars! but what wasn't great? the sound engineers. twice during muse's set the sound plain cut out completely and everyone was waiting for some 3-8 minutes until they remedied the problem and the show got back underway. twice. this could've normally put a real damper on the night, but the fact that muse played for at least two hours pretty much nullified that. here's a novice panoramic shot.
movie 1 | movie 2
i just did a whole huge entry. whole thing done. pics and everything. then blue screen. goodnight.

so, i know everyone's wondering how i took those recent pics of maddy when my camera's been missing. well, there was a get together at steph's on sat night and it was my first time there since the bbq, which was hte last place it was seen at. so i took the liberty of searching myself and finally found it stuffed way down into the bowels of her couch. i'm so happy. mostly because i have two concerts this week. muse tomorrow night and andrew motherfuckin w.k. thursday. if i didn't get pics of the latter, i would slice my wrists. finding a home for maddy sucks. i got a few people who seriously want her, but it's hard to pick the right one. i can't ask, "on a scale of 1 to 10, how much will you love her?" so i have to somehow decide based on simple questions about whether they've raised a kitten before, what other animals they have, and other junk. and it's harder to decide on one person knwoing that i'll have to inform the other half dozen that i found a home for her and it won't be theirs. this disturbs me slighty. the only reason i can think of is because mario's going to show david and he's likely going to eat it up. i'll hear him use "lollerskates" for at least two weeks. right now i feel my allergies affecting me more than my sickness, so i'm going to take an allegra, go to sleep, and hope for the best when i wake up. goodnight.

friday morning she was sleeping on my lap and i had to get up to get ready for work so i put her on my bed and went to brush my teeth. she didn't want to be up there so she jumped off and yelled out as soon as she hit the floor. she's jumped down from my bed dozens of times before, but she was groggy this time and landed wrong. i gave her two minutes to walk it off in case it was a simple sprain, but it didn't get any better and already started to swell. i called in late to work and took her to the vet where i left her for xrays. called vet later from work and she told me it looked like a hairline fracture on her growth plate (part of the bone that grows) and a week-long splint should be enough. they keep her overnight since i wasn't able to pick her up before they closed and since she doesn't need to be running around so soon anyway. pick her up the next morning with monique and she picked up the $180 bill since my finances are a joke right now. thank you, babe. i owe you. oh, and i'm still sick.

i can't keep maddy. the landlord decided to hate her for some reason. on top of that, thanh, the mom in the house that i only see on weekends maybe, has breathing problems made worse by the cat. there's really no way around it--i have to find her a new home. she's the perfect kitten who deserves a perfect owner and place to live. i will absolutely insist that she remains indoor-only. her new home must be a clean and safe environemnt for her to grow up healthy and happy. it would sure be nice to find a friend who could take her so i could watch her grow up. this sucks.

Landlord is not liable for any damage said pets may cause to property surrounding the premesism, or to other persons or animals, and tenant agrees to idemnify and hold harmless landlord from all claims or actions resulting from same, including costs of defense, and legal fees. no pets other than the pets indentified in this descriptive heading 17. DAMAGE DEPOSIT.

saw kill bill 2 last night with darci, mario, and our token black friend, chris. it was SO entertaining and fun. i loved it. quentin is good. has anyone seen my camera? }:< the new girl in my life is superb. wonderful. she makes me happy. i feel bad for not officially mentioning her in here earlier, but there were/are some issues concerning other people being weird about it. i hope they come around. i'm going to be nothing but proud from here on out. see you tonight, monique.

maddy didn't run out from under the bed when i walked in, nor did she run out from david's room. i broke out my flashlight and made my clicky noises, but nothing. i noticed she was clean out of food so i made some more and would look for her after. i put her bowl back in her eating spot in my room, continued to look for her, and not even a minute later, fucking sammy walks out my room licking his lips. i find her bowl and it's totally empty. i let him smell the bowl and proceeded to beat the little fucker's ass. now i'm panicking, thinking he ate all her food 10 minutes after i left for work some 16 hours earlier and she's gone hungry ever since. that she's curled up somewhere starved to death or near it. the last place i wanted to check was david/serena's room since they're sleeping, but i finally had to wake them up. david muttered out places to look for her and i finally found her behind their couch, curled up. i felt relief, bet even moreso once i reached for her and she looked up at me. i took her to her bowl and she ate half the damn thing right there. i feel terrible.
it's so weird for you to go after something you want and get it. well, it is for me, anyway. i'm ecstatic. and scared. and more ecstatic. and lucky. in the wise words of brooke, "don't screw up."

Taurus & Virgo Two Earth-ruled signs which value tranquillity and discretion, they have all the ingredients for a harmonious love affair. Anxious Virgo finds reassurance in the stolid Bull, whereas the Taurean derives needed peace and energy from the Virgoan. A caress, a gaze, a gesture: each is worth a thousand words, when it comes to expressing the tenderness that binds them together. Taurus dominates, to the delight of clinging vine Virgo. "The power of harmony, and the deep power of joy..."

got back from her checkup at the vet and she verified that she does have fleas. she gave her a pill that somehow kills all the fleas on her body within 4 hours?!? and we can't find a cure for asthma or the common cold. weird. then i came home and gave her a bath. even though it looks like she's taking a swing, she's not. ilike to pretend she did, though. i'm so sleepy it hurts. i slept like hell until i got up at 6 nd showered and ate. and went back to bed at, like, 8. then had to wake up early to take miss thing to the vet. she goes back in two weeks for her first shots.

i'm so hapy and shit. i don't know if it's the wine or whatever else. we had a wonmderful little bbqq tonight with some close folks and had a good time. hod a pleasantly surprising and all-too-relieving (read: bitchin) chat. brooke came and gave me my super camera and scoped out my punkcore kitty. why do girls want to stewal her? girls are selfish, backstabbing vengeful reatures. but that's a gross generalization. some are nice. befoe all that i installed my perfect old pioneer cd deck in my jettaz0rz. it sounds a lot better, but the annoying bose amp is still the weak point. it'll tkae some money and a good solid day or two to make everyhing how i want it. then i will play hte loudest starting line song ever in a car! awesome. nerd. my mom;'s getting married july 2nd and said i could bring afriend. it's just at her little house in boulder creek with some friends and family. she advertised free beer, but i'm not gonna drink in front of my aun and grandma tha i hardly ever see. lol. that'd be odd. yes,. lol. thanks to david's gf, serena, for helping me cut off kitties dingleberries while i was drunk. i'm gona go to sleep before maddy wakesd up and my buzz wears off.

monique, stephanie, alisha, mario, and i went bowling (my thumb is mutilated), to denny's (french vanilla cappucino tastes like waffles w/ syrup), and to steph's where we ended up watching cable guy. got home late and didn't realize how much i missed my cat! apparently she missed me too cuz she wanted 10 solid minutes of love and then some 20 minutes of playing. after the usual wrestling-type playing, she did a new thing where she hides between two things and runs out at my hand, and i open it up like to attack her and she dives back in her hole. i swear we did it 20 times before she got tired of it. then we did another new thing where she hides behind an open door and we try to get each other through the hinge side. then mario and i played battlefield while she napped on my lap. now she's up and playing in the box i brought her home in. she has dingleberries i need to take care of and i made her first vet appt for monday morning. goodnight, everyone.
being clean being a nerd being curious playing and pooping
i got her from work! i think it's a her! she's awesome! she runs up to me! she loves me already! she loves the food i got her! hasn't pooped or peed yet! will name her later!

so i get home from work and my msn messenger tells me, "No new e-mail messages." really, now?? so i check my inbox anyway and there's a good 12+ lj comment deals and some other semi-important stuff i've gotten over the past day or two. i just never realized msn was screwy. now i feel loved, in a nerdy way. selling my truck! please buy. c'mon, it's shiney! for now. sorta. or just spread the word. i'll do an entry in in a few days... mario and i watched texas chainsaw massacre remake at stephanie's last night. it was more gross than anything. it ended up being a comedy, nonetheless. my bed is awesome but it's even lonelier, being bigger and all. i love my car. i love brooke's appreciation for the simple things. it just occurred to me that none of you will be able to see it if you already haven't. oh well. having a good, loud, cd-playing system in a car is severely underrated. i was going to start installing this weekend, but crutchfield failed to send me a critical part of the harness for my deck. they sent it by now and i WILL do it this weekend or bust. i wanna try to make a trip to oregon this summer at some point and visit jesse, see some new scenery, and breath some fresh(er) air. tomorrow morning i'm going to my dad's to do things, go to saceuro to give jake (salesman) his tenacious D cd back, and tower records to buy incubus tix. i didn't realize i have friday off until today. yay for religious freaks. edit: we miss you, kurt.
